posts.post_content:
the design of the artwork is fantastic - you can see every existing atog card older than this one displayed there. *(from left bottom corner to right upper corner: [Chronatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chronatog), [Atog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Atog), [Auratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auratog), [Necratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necratog), [Foratog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foratog))*.  
especially the name is genious, and the stats are also suiting perfectly to this card!  
yet it's such a pity he doesn't have trample. a guy like this should actually be a finisher.  
maybe they didn't give him this ability as there wasn't any other atog that gained more than increased p/t.  
[Megatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megatog) broke this consistancy anyways some years later...
posts.html:
the design of the artwork is fantastic - you can see every existing atog card older than this one displayed there. (from left bottom corner to right upper corner: Chronatog, Atog, Auratog, Necratog, Foratog).
especially the name is genious, and the stats are also suiting perfectly to this card!
yet it's such a pity he doesn't have trample. a guy like this should actually be a finisher.
maybe they didn't give him this ability as there wasn't any other atog that gained more than increased p/t.
Megatog broke this consistancy anyways some years later...

Posted By: JaceIsAwesome (7/18/2012 11:45:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Atogatog is funny-lookin', but he's pretty terrible. If you're playing an atog deck, you sort of feel like you should be playing their lord, which is one of the worst creatures ever, so he leads to moral dilemmas as well as lost games. An experiment: build a deck that includes Atogatog, but not [Dragon Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Gate). I guarantee you that the deck will be better if you replace the Atogatog with a [Sliver Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver Queen), even if the deck contains zero other Slivers and many Atogs. Even if the deck contains [Plague Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Sliver).
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Has anyone considered shapeshifters or various cloning devices? Throw this in a [Soul Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Foundry) and pay 5 per turn to make a 10/10 every turn. Have fun and make it unblockable. Or even [Mirror Entity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Entity). Make all of your creatures 6/6, then sac all of them, then attack. Play [Cephalid Pathmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Pathmage) the turn before, then tap and sac to make Atogatog unblockable.

Posted By: Arachnos (4/13/2012 11:23:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I actually found a way to make this work! put lance or some other first-strike granting enchantment on Auratog. Then play enchanted evening. Then wing with both auratog and atogatog. Assuming neither are blocked, sacrifice everything but lance and atogatog to auratog, then, once auratog deals damage, sac it to the legend. This should deal a minimum 31 damage, 19 of it general damage, if this is EDH.
posts.html:
